newsitem.title: GREECE: SIGMA MAINTAINS LEAD IN AUG AS BOURSE VOLUME RISES.
newsitem.headline: SIGMA MAINTAINS LEAD IN AUG AS BOURSE VOLUME RISES.

text.p: Sigma Securities led Greek brokers in August market share with
9.33 percent of the bourse's trading volume, followed by N.
Devletoglou with 9.31 percent, as was the case in July.
But August's pick up in volume unveiled rerankings as member
firms battled it out for market share.
Ranking third was National Securities, overtaking Alpha
Brokerage which saw its market share fold to 4.14 percent in
Also losing market share were Omega and Telesis Securities
which gave up its fifth place to Kappa. Telesis saw its share
worsen to 3.80 percent in August, dropping to number seven.
Omega which ranked seventh in July also gave up market share
Kappa Securities which launched operations in late April
improved its market share to 3.91 from 2.30 percent in July and
climbed to number five. It ranked 11th in July and 23rd in May.
Euroxx put out steady performance, holding on at number six
with 3.88 percent of the bourse's volume.
Trading volume in August improved to 288.6 billion drachmas,
up from 252.5 billion a month earlier. January remained the
bourse's best month so far this year with turnover hitting 428.8
billion drachmas and May the worst with 209 billion.
